edge: Carl idolizes Charles Muntz, who is discredited when a giant bird skeleton he brought back from Paradise Falls in South America is deemed a fake. Muntz travels back to the falls, vowing not to return until he brings back a live specimen.
Carl befriends Ellie, another young Muntz fan.
Ellie dreams of moving her 'clubhouse' to Paradise Falls and have adventures of her own.
Carl and Ellie eventually marry, renovate the clubhouse and move in.
Carl works at the city zoo as a balloon salesman.
Ellie keeps working at the city zoo as a zookeeper, respectively.
Ellie keeps a scrapbook of her adventures and dreams.
Carl surprises Ellie with tickets to South America.
Ellie falls ill and is hospitalized.
Ellie gives Carl her scrapbook before she dies.
After unintentionally injuring a construction worker, Carl is ordered by a court to move into an assisted living facility.
Carl resolves to keep his promise to Ellie to move their house to Paradise Falls.
Russell becomes an accidental stowaway and attempts to earn his final merit badge for assisting the elderly.
Carl and Russell encounter a giant, flightless bird whom Russell names Kevin.
After failed attempts to get rid of the animals, Carl reluctantly allows both Kevin and Dug to join the party.
The house lands on a tepui opposite Paradise Falls.
The pack of dogs are owned by Charles Muntz.
All dogs in the pack wear collar translators to facilitate communication between them and their master Charles Muntz.

node_2: pack of dogs wearing collar translators
edge: Charles Muntz is the owner of the pack of dogs wearing collar translators.
Charles Muntz is a 92-year-old version of himself.
Charles Muntz has been on a quest to capture the bird mentioned in the context.
Charles Muntz has captured and displayed the skeleton of the bird he is trying to capture.
The skeleton of the bird resembles Kevin, as mentioned in the context.
Muntz's dogs pursue Carl and Russell after they flee from Muntz's airship.
Muntz's dogs have previously murdered other travelers who were suspected of seeking the bird that Kevin is also looking for, as mentioned in the context.
Carl and Russell find Kevin and take her home as per the context.
Muntz captures Kevin in his quest to capture the bird, as mentioned in the context.
Muntz starts a fire beneath Carl's home as part of his pursuit to capture the bird that Kevin represents.
Carl's wife has filled in blank pages of her scrapbook with photos of their life together.
The text 'Thanks for the adventure – now go have a new one!' is written by Carl's wife on blank pages of her scrapbook.
Carl becomes reinvigorated after discovering the text 'Thanks for the adventure – now go have a new one!' written by his wife on blank pages of her scrapbook.
Russell flies after Kevin using balloons and a leaf blower, as mentioned in the context.
Russell uses both leaf blowers and balloons to fly after Kevin.
Carl lightens his house, enabling it to soar again due to the presence of leaves in or around it.
Russell arrives at Muntz's airship, but is caught.
Carl and Dug, who had been hiding on Carl's back porch,
Muntz pursues them and traps Russell, Kevin and Dug inside the house.
Carl and Dug board the dirigible and free him and Kevin.
Carl and Dug, who had been hiding on Carl's back porch,
Muntz leaps after them, but his leg gets tangled in balloon strings,
Carl saves them just as the tether breaks.
The house descends out of sight beneath the clouds.
Carl presents Russell with a grape soda bottle cap Ellie gave Carl when they first met,
Unbeknownst to Carl, the house lands on the cliff overlooking Paradise Falls,
